definition: to announce/to read (the news)
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
announcer

sentences.english: Here are the headlines in today's news.
sentences.chinese: 現在播報今天的新聞提要。

sentences.english: Does Radio Beijing broadcast the news every hour on the hour?
sentences.chinese: 北京廣播臺每小時整點播報新聞嗎？

sentences.english: At six-thirty he listens to the news on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 他六點半聽收音機播報的新聞。

sentences.english: One-minute, comprehensive business updates 14 times a day.
sentences.chinese: 一分鐘綜合商業新聞，一天更新播報十四次。

sentences.english: The weatherman's forecast for today's weather certainly came true .
sentences.chinese: 氣象播報員對今天的天氣所做的預十分準確。

sentences.english: For your convenience, we will announce the time of the first and the last trains.
sentences.chinese: 爲方便您乘車，我們將播報首末車時間。

sentences.english: Later in our program, we will hear about a deadly viral disease in China.
sentences.chinese: 在隨後的節目中，我們將播報中國的一場致命病毒病。

sentences.english: From Washington, this is VOA news. I'm David DeForest reporting.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是美國之音在華盛頓播報的新聞。

sentences.english: Please make an interview in groups, and then make a report to the whole class.
sentences.chinese: 請學生以小組爲單位完成採訪和新聞播報的任務。

sentences.english: At six-thirty he accepts to the account on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 他六點半聽收音機播報的消息。

sentences.english: Use capital letters for anything your talent is going to read on-air.
sentences.chinese: 用大寫字母寫下你的播報員將要播報的任何語句。

sentences.english: Use capital letters for anything your talent is going to read on-air.
sentences.chinese: 用大寫字母寫下你的播報員將要播報的任何語句。

sentences.english: The newscaster is searching for clues and working around the clock in his affiliation.
sentences.chinese: 這新聞播報員正在找線索及在他的服務機構日夜工作。

sentences.english: On Friday nights, he announces Nucla High football games.
sentences.chinese: 在週五晚上，他負責播報紐克拉高中的美式足球比賽。

sentences.english: The B. B. C. are not often late (in) broadcasting the news.
sentences.chinese: 英國廣播公司通常能及時播報新聞。

sentences.english: You are listening to the news on Bavarian Radio.
sentences.chinese: 您現在所收聽的是巴伐利亞電臺爲你播報的新聞。

definition: on-the-spot live broadcast

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
television program
live (e.g. broadcast or recording)/what is actually happening/scene/the real situation
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
(originally) to provide assistance/(more recently) to show one's support (for a singing idol etc)
radio station
to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
forum (esp. online)/discussion area/feedback
dummy run/to run through sth/to rehearse
barrage (military)/"bullet screen", function which allows viewers to post on-screen comments in videos, movies etc in real time/danmaku (video game subgenre)
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
